Public Functions

timeDateString 
 char *timeDateString(DateTime *dt)
Return a date string. Return a pointer to a 11 character date string in the form: "2004-NOV-15". The string "-" is returned for an invalid date.
timeDateToEpoch 
 double timeDateToEpoch(DateTime *dt)
Convert a DateTime to epochal time. (seconds since 1970/1/1). The DateTime structure is defined as: 
 
  typedef struct {
     int year;
     int month;
     int day;
     int hour;
     int minute;
     double second;
  } DateTime;

Parameters:
dt - Input DateTime structure.
Returns:
The epochal time.
timeDayOfYear 
 int timeDayOfYear(int year,
                   int month,
                   int day)
Return the day of year for input year, month and day.

Parameters:
year - The year (four digits).
month - The month (1-12)
day - The day of the month (1-31)
Returns:
the day of year beginning with 1.
timeDOY 
 int timeDOY(DateTime *dt)
Return the day of year for a DateTime.

Parameters:
dt - Input DateTime structure.
Returns:
The day of year, beginning with 1.
timeEpochDays 
 int timeEpochDays(DateTime *dt)
Return epochal days. Return the number of days for the DataTime since 1/1/1970.

Parameters:
dt - The input DateTime structure.
Returns:
the number of days since 1970/1/1.
timeEpochToDate 
 void timeEpochToDate(double epoch,
                      DateTime *dt)
Convert an epochal time to a DateTime.

Parameters:
epoch - The input epochal time.
dt - A pointer to a DataTime structure that will be filled.
timeEpochToGMT 
 char *timeEpochToGMT(double epochal,
                      int num_decimals)
Convert epochal time to a string as GMT.

Parameters:
epochal - The epochal time.
num_decimals - The number of decimal places to print.
Returns:
Returns a pointer to a static string with the GMT time.
timeEpochToJDate 
 int timeEpochToJDate(double epoch)
Return the JDate. Return the JDate for an epoch time. The JDate is 1000*year + day_of_year

Parameters:
epoch - The epoch time.
Returns:
JDate.
timeGetEpoch 
 double timeGetEpoch()
Return system time as an epochal time. Return the system time in seconds since 00:00:00 1970/1/1. Returns NULL_TIME if cannot get system time.
timeJDate 
 int timeJDate(DateTime *dt)
Return the JDate. Return the JDate for a DateTime. The JDate is 1000*year + day_of_year

Parameters:
dt - Input DateTime structure.
Returns:
JDate.
timeLoadDate 
 char *timeLoadDate()
Return a standard load date string. Return a pointer to a 9 character string containing the system time in the form: "01-NOV-91".
timeMonthDay 
 void timeMonthDay(int year,
                   int day_of_year,
                   int *month,
                   int *day)
Convert day of year to month and day of month.

Parameters:
year - Input year.
day_of_year - Input day of year.
month - Output month of year beginning with 1.
day - Output day of month (1-31).
timeMonthName 
 const char *timeMonthName(int month)
Return the month name. Return a character string month name for a month index, beginning with 1 for January.

Parameters:
month - The index of the month beginning with 1.
Returns:
a static char string containing the month name.
